history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile: his manuscript no. 6; his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153).
Acquisition: Ḥanah bat Yeḥiel: given to her son Yeḳutiel as a gift on 23 Adar [5]280 [1520]: inscribed in a note (folio 380v).
